data.title: Awesome venue
data.text: This place looks awesome on the outside and it doesn't disappoint when you go inside the interior is just so funky with so many cool things to look at, and the outside in the courtyard matches. What a fab place to go and enjoy some great tasting food or indulge in a few cheeky cocktails, its a great bar to get away from the craziness of Fremont and its really well priced compared with the strip prices of Vegas at the moment, and the food that we ordered was top notch.

data.title: A Nice Break from the Fremont Experience
data.text: The venue is a quite break from the hectic Fremont Street Experience. It offers indoor and outdoor seating in a very pleasant environment. No slot machines, no television, and no loud music are great for a temporary escape from the typical Las Vegas venue. The service and drinks are very good. The build your own burger (BYOB) is a good option on a varied menu. I look forward to returning soon.

data.title: Bit of a let down
data.text: We went here after seeing it on man v food and the food from the show is not actually served there- there are no lobster sliders. We went for the garbage fries and buffalo wings which were pretty good, but it was over priced for what it was. Also door staff weren't tourist friendly, they were going to stop my 40 yr old fiancé from going in as he didn't have id- which we thought was a bit excessive

data.title: Awesome venue, disappointing food
data.text: I really wanted to love this place. I'm sitting in a stunning garden backyard patio with very well priced prosecco, and I want this to be a place that I can come back to over and over again. Sadly, the food, for some reason, has absolutely no flavor. It's not just me, the mimosas taste perfectly fine, but somehow they've managed to take all the flavor out of everything else. Everything on the menu looks amazing, so it was pretty disappointing. I'm not even sure how they did it, other than a total lack of seasoning. It's not that anything tastes bad, just that I couldn't taste anything at all.

data.title: Best Meal In Vegas
data.text: Hands down, the best food we ate in Vegas. A welcome break from the overpriced, bog standard 'food court' restaurants everywhere else. Great location in the heart of the downtown action, great beer selection, friendly staff. I had the chicken waffle sandwich and the chicken wings, both were amazing. Highly recommended.

data.title: A Quirky Haven in Downtown Vegas
data.text:
Really enjoyed our visit here for early evening dinner/snacks and a beer. Staff friendly and food simple but good with a decent selection of beers. I'd describe the decor as quirky and worth taking a look around and taking it all in - it won't be to everyone's taste but will leave an impression!

We chose to eat outside, despite the heat, and the sprinkler system provided welcome relief in a pleasant atmosphere with the small courtyard a little haven where you can, at least for a little while, forget about the Vegas madness outside.

A must visit if  you're staying downtown on or  around Freemont St and even worth the journey if  you're based a little further away on the "strip". Highly recommended.

data.title: Best place downtown
data.text: Visited this gem with my family after reading the reviews on trip advisor. The reviews did not do it justice. Great little place, we felt comfortable, safe and enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere. After only popping in for one drink, we stayed the full night and grabbed dinner there too.  Everything was lovely and reasonably priced. A MUST for people looking to escape the bright lights of Vegas. Will visit this place again.

data.title: Awesome joint amidst the insanity
data.text: Gotta love a somewhat quieter, more laid-back bar in the these parts. Bartenders are friendly, recommend good drinks, and create drinks to your liking.

data.title: Great burgers..cool vibe !
data.text: This tucked-away spot was recommended to us by our Uber driver when we went to Fremont Street.  It has a nice patio and the bar is also open to the street so we sat inside since it was pretty warm out. Lots of craft beer on tap and in bottles and also a nice hand-crafted cocktail list.  Small but interesting menu, but I recommend the BYOB..build your own burger.  Choose your meat, toppings, and sides ..great!  Served on a wooden block (see photo) ..delicious!! Check out the weird artwork on the walls..especially in the restrooms..and don't miss the cool patio in the back..complete with a hidden teeter-totter in the back.

data.title: A nice bar on the quiet end of Fremont.
data.text: This is a nice pit stop as you approach the Fremont Experience and offers a range of international beers. There is also an outside area with lots of tables. International bottled beers go for around $8.00 and national $6.00.

data.title: Very Cool, Very Hip and deserves your patronage
data.text:
I loved this place from the decor, art, cups and menu. Pleasant departure from your usual Freemont/Vegas fare. Everything was just so cool without trying. This established was obviously conceived by someone with passion offering a welcome break from the eatery clones around the city.

You may have guess I loved this place

data.title: For people watching & nibbles
data.text: I like the location for eating after dark, sat at the bar. A few local brews available, with the bar staff knowledgeable on styles and tastes. Had the garbage fries and hotdog (which arrived 5 minutes apart is my only criticism).

data.title: Great food, cute setting
data.text: My husband and I both had a burger here and it was one of the best burgers we have ever had!!!! You can add/remove items as you like, so make it exactly how you want it. The cocktails are also delicious! Highly recommend this place to anyone in the area!

data.title: A Little Unhappy
data.text: My friend and I went here just because we saw it on a secret eats show hosted by Adam Richman. He spoke about the famous lobster sliders that were not on the menu that you had to ask for when you got there. Unfortunately when we are for them we were told they do not exist and that it was only done for the show. I was very disappointed but we decided to eat there anyway. The food was good and the mac and cheese balls are great.

data.title: Cocktails and Trivial Pursuit
data.text:
This place was a stand out find amongst the numerous bars and restaurants in Vegas, well worth the trip away from the Strip to Fremont.
The bar is full of character and has a great atmosphere. The food menu had some brilliant twists on classics - so tasty. Excellent beer and cocktail selection. Happily spent hours drinking the cocktail list and playing trivial pursuit - winning combination!

data.title: A Nice Middle Ground Between the Strip and Fremont Street
data.text:
The tourist part of Vegas is really two places. The strip is excess and expense. Fremont Street is old Vegas (excess and less expensive). Park sits in a nice middle ground between the extremes. The food is really good and not the cheap eats you'll find elsewhere on Fremont Street. You can come hear to enjoy a meal not simply eat. I sat outside in the patio and would recommend the same. Even on a hot night. It was very pleasant, even so close to Fremont Street. 

Many people talk about "Garbage" one of the menu favorites. It's really doctored fries. It's very good if that's what you're looking for. In addition, I enjoyed the fish tacos and thought they were a better meal.

data.title: A wedding to remember
data.text: I was lucky enough to attend my brothers wedding at this quirky little place in June.  From the outside you would never believe how beautiful the inside is. The wedding was in the garden which was beautifully decorated with quirky door knockers and Mediterranean plates. The furniture all painted to match the theme. The staff were outstanding and worked their busts off all day. Our glasses were left empty for all of a second. The fun see saw was enjoyed by all and the art work was a talking point. Amazing venue, great staff and highly recommended

data.title: Great experience downtown
data.text: Thank goodness someone told me about this place prior to our last trip to Vegas.  This was by far our best time in a restaurant.  Service was great, food was amazing, and drinks were the best we had on the trip.  Would highly recommend this place for meal, hanging out or any occasion.

data.title: This place is a must if you're downtown Vegas!
data.text: In the middle of crazy Downtown Vegas there is this hip, quaint courtyard to get away from it all. The atmosphere is priceless and our service was second to none. The menu is limited bar food but tasty. Our table tried a few things. Chicken finger bites are huge and delicious. Sweet potato tots are great as well. I ordered the chicken and waffles, they were average. The highlight was the cookie skillet. Best I've ever had!  Can't wait to try a burger next year!!

data.title: Feels like a Wes Anderson movie
data.text: The decorations are fun and quirky.  I felt like a character in a Wes Anderson film!  The food and service here are great.  Definitely check it out.
